channel.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“RemiM, post:13, topic:441513”]I found this piece of code in client.java:

[code] case 70:
// atObject3
objectX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
objectY = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
objectID = inStream.readUnsignedWordBigEndianA();
if (debug)
println_debug("atObject3: " + objectX + “,” + objectY
+ " objectID: " + objectID);

		boolean oooFound = false;
		TurnPlayerTo(objectX, objectY);
		for (Object o : server.objects) {
			if ((o.type == 3) && (objectX == o.x) && (objectY == o.y)
					&& (objectID == o.id)) {
				oooFound = true;
				break;
			}
		}
		
		if (!oooFound && adding)
			server.objects.add(new Object(objectID, objectX, objectY, 3));

		if (oooFound && (objectID == 1739)) {
			heightLevel -= 1;
			toX = absX;
			toY = absY;
		}
		break;[/code]

I’m not quite sure what packet 70 is, but does this load information about all objects?
Or just a certain kind of objects, (it says atObject3)?[/quote]

thats the 3rd click option of an object (bank booth-> talk,bank,((collect))

Read full topic
item.source: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

You have to read the map files from the cache. So you can know where the objects are placed on the map.

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @RemiM RemiM
item.description:
@RemiM wrote:

I found this piece of code in client.java:

[code] case 70:
// atObject3
objectX = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
objectY = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
objectID = inStream.readUnsignedWordBigEndianA();
if (debug)
println_debug("atObject3: " + objectX + “,” + objectY
+ " objectID: " + objectID);

		boolean oooFound = false;
		TurnPlayerTo(objectX, objectY);
		for (Object o : server.objects) {
			if ((o.type == 3) && (objectX == o.x) && (objectY == o.y)
					&& (objectID == o.id)) {
				oooFound = true;
				break;
			}
		}
		
		if (!oooFound && adding)
			server.objects.add(new Object(objectID, objectX, objectY, 3));

		if (oooFound && (objectID == 1739)) {
			heightLevel -= 1;
			toX = absX;
			toY = absY;
		}
		break;[/code]

I’m not quite sure what packet 70 is, but does this load information about all objects?
Or just a certain kind of objects, (it says atObject3)?

Read full topic
item.source: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:11, topic:441513”]You maybe could save the coordinates of the fire to somewhere, storing the data, and removing it again when the fire dies.
Wouldn’t be the best way to do it but would work.[/quote]

What I’m doing is having a list of the “active” objects in the current region, each with a lifespan; which yb default is for however long the region is loaded into the memory. But for objects like Fires, and things like ground items, they can just have a set time.

Read full topic

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

You maybe could save the coordinates of the fire to somewhere, storing the data, and removing it again when the fire dies.
Wouldn’t be the best way to do it but would work.

item.source: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The problem is that there are some default objects set to the map client-side, that the server couldn’t POSSIBLY know about, unless it loaded all of the client-side objects as well (which, to my knowledge, no server does)

Read full topic
item.source: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“RemiM, post:6, topic:441513”][quote author=matzie link=topic=544211.msg3989283#msg3989283 date=1336345135]
arent objects on your map client sided? if every object was server sided wouldn’t no-clipping be ineffective?

The server needs to know where every object is, o.o
[/quote]

I know that objects are client sided, but I’ve seen reference to server.objects arraylist for objects, not sure if it’s a valid arraylist that actually loads information about objects though…[/quote]
i think that is for objects that people have added? :o
-OR-
is the object your standing on a 1x1?

Read full topic

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @RemiM RemiM
item.description:
@RemiM wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:441513”][quote author=RemiM link=topic=544211.msg3989278#msg3989278 date=1336344845]

Why would you use a command for firemaking? just saying.

I’m not using a command for firemaking… I’m using the command to test if the method works, which you can clearly read from the code I posted…
[/quote]

No waySarcasm. But when you say:

trying to make perfect firemaking

It would make people wonder, like i did, why you posted a command, instead of something like a void or boolean.[/quote]

Just added in what it was for incase people had other solutions

item.title: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @RemiM RemiM
item.description:
@RemiM wrote:

So I’m trying to make perfect firemaking and for that I need to check if there is an object at specific coordinates,
So I made this command and walked on top of objects to check if I could get it working, but every time I do it
it says there isn’t an object there.

Command:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("test")) { for (Object o : server.objects) { if (c.absX == o.x && c.absY == o.y) { c.sM("Object is here"); return; } } c.sM("Object is not here."); }
Is there something wrong with the for loop? (First time I’ve tried using it) or is the arraylist in server class not valid?

Thanks in advance

Read full topic
item.source: Checking if an object is at specific coordinates [Delta]
